intro: Hiraea idroboana, commonly known as the Idroboan herb, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
